entities.name: fudge
entities.description: Fudge is a gerbil that appeared in front of the Prime Minister. It was described as an 'ugly little man' who announced Fudge's arrival.

entities.name: the prime minister
entities.description: The Prime Minister is the main character of the story. He is trying to convince himself that Fudge was a hallucination.

entities.name: fudge's arrival
entities.description: Fudge's arrival is an event that is mentioned in the text. It is described as being announced by 'the ugly little man' who turned out to be Fudge.

entities.name: the chancellor of the exchequer
entities.description: The Chancellor of the Exchequer is a person who tried to remove the portrait of Fudge from the wall.

entities.name: the art historian
entities.description: The Art Historian is a person who tried to remove the portrait of Fudge from the wall.

relationships.description: Fudge appeared in front of the Prime Minister.
The Prime Minister is trying to convince himself that Fudge was a hallucination related to his election campaign.
The Chancellor of the Exchequer tried to remove the portrait of Fudge from the wall.
The Art Historian tried to remove the portrait of Fudge from the wall.
